comment: Honestly, it was fine.

TAKE HER!! I loved how she set up her D2L page, beginning of the course consisted of checklist grades based on if you actually open up content. weekly ALEKS HW is easy, just do it (2 are dropped). PRINT OUT POWERPOINT NOTES & WATCH THE VIDEOS (makes notetaking, quizzes and tests *open note so much easier) Notes close prior to quizzes and exams.

Prof Parkhurst was a good prof but she wasnt the best. A lot of HW and i mean a lot you get 2-3 hw a week with a total of around 40 questions and then also a quiz. Tests are all lockdown but no camera including finals.3 attempts per hw i would take this class its not that hard of a class with her
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: I'm not awesome at math but this professor really laid the class out so its easier to understand. The homework was very easy and the quizzes were easy as well. Only way to fail this class is if you don't  do your work. Awesome class.

Professor Parkhurst is a great instructor! I enjoyed taking her class as she truly portrayed her lessons in a way that was easy to understand! Lecture heavy but worth it to understand the content. Tests can be difficult but I am not good at math so this could be a personal thing. Lots of homework but 3 attempts. STUDY! She provides great material!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Pretty easy class! A LOT of lectures videos but they were very helpful especially with the notes she provided. ALEKS were wayy more challenging than the quizzes/exams, so if you get the ALEKS you're pretty much set content-wise. Did get more difficult/work-heavy towards the end but just follow the semester/weekly schedule to stay on top of it all.

Absolute queen I love her. I am not good at stat, I failed in high school but this class was a breeze. Lots of vids but they help a lot, and I don't really study too much. uiz and exams use lockdown but no camera, so you can use notes. I

This class was extremely manageable, just be prepared to take a lot of notes (they're super helpful and straightforward, though). Prof. Parkhurst is also very kind and forgiving. I had technical issues on a quiz and she dropped the grade. She also gives opportunities for extra credit and responds promptly to emails. Take this class!

This teacher's class is not the issue. There is no leniency on her end. She isn't forgiving. I had covid right before our second exam and asked her to give me a day or two extra to recover so i'm not completely out of it beforehand. She just said "you can use that as your one dropped exam grade" Timed quiz so if ur slow w math, good luck
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: I'm really bad at math... That being said, I'm really glad I chose this as my last math course. Practically everything can be done on the calculator. There are LOTS of lecture videos and online homework so this class was sometimes time consuming. BUT she drops the lowest quiz grade and gives extra credit. This is a pretty easy math class! Take it!

Very disappointed with the Professor as this should be taught in a better manner and be more helpful to the students. She had minimal examples on her classes and harder stuff on her quizzes/exams. Also, for some reason she closes the chapter material in the 36 hour timeframe we have for the quizzes/exams and also she posts incomplete PowerPoints

This class was pretty simple. The lectures were easy to go by. The professor was nice and responded to my emails if I had a problem. It did begin to get more difficult as the semester went on but as long as you take notes and follow along and do the homework, then you'll be fine.

Math has not always been me strong suite, but Instructor Parkhurst made the material easy to understand. Lecture heavy. Make sure you pay attention and take good notes. Homework is very time consuming but helps. The quizzes and exams are based off the methods she teaches in the lectures. Do the work and practice, practice, practice.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: I took this class completely online and have had a terrible experience with her. I had to miss a quiz because I went out of state for a funeral in the family and received a 0% on the quiz with not effort to let me make it up even for partial credit. I even asked if I could take it before I left. Takes at least a week to get an email back.

I took this class online and the aleks is easy and so is the quizzes however she has aleks assignments due tuesdays and sundays if you miss an exam you cannot take it the quizzes are timed and so are the exams. I wouldnt take this teacher again. Sometimes the videos dont even match up with the quizzes.

Taken as an online class, along with a semester full of online classes. Not only was she the only one to not hold office hours, was not at all accessible over email for help. Felt completely alone taking this class. I am not a math person and only got a good grade in this class through sheer luck in my opinion, along with HOURS spent studying

One of the easiest classes Ive taken. Didnt take much effort. For an online class, content was easy to learn. Her lectures were quite annoying (just the way she teaches) but you tend to get used to it. ALEKS HW was easy, had severally easy quizzes, and 5 tests. No Lockdown Browser which is a plus! Definitely worth taking and an easy A.

I am very bad at math and her lectures were easy to follow. She just does not grade a lot of the work and your homework only weighs a small percent. I did find it helpful that the lectures were recorded and you could go back at any time. However, she would close the unit or units off on D2L before tests/quizzes. Do the work and you will be fine.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: There were a lot of videos in the course in place of lectures. For anyone with prior statistical work this could will be a breeze; that is they could likely do the entire course in a week's time. For anyone new to statistics the way the prof organizes and explains things will help learn the basics of statistics.

This was an easy A. There were 3 projects, and she just gave us a video on how to do them and all we had to do was copy it exactly. The quizzes were straight from her lectures. Very direct , to the point, and no fluff. Definitely take her for an easy A

Professor Parkhurst is a good professor. Stats is not an easy class but the material was easy to follow. There are four projects to do on your own which are easy. She dropped the lowest quiz and there was a midterm and a final.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: If you can follow directions you can get an A in her class. I found it really easy because I had taken intro stats before this class and it's basically the same content. The projects are literally just copying exactly what she does and turning it in, and the quizzes and tests are just repeating the procedures.

Dr. Parkhurst gave a good async course. It seemed as though she was figuring out the course structure as the semester progressed but the changes errored in the students favor. The last half of the semester skewed towards absurdity. It seems like the content stopped after Oct. The projects were not a test of skill but retention to video specifcs.

Lecture heavy, nice person but as an online instructor, not a good experience. The course is on auto-pilot for the first half, consisting of recorded past lectures. Notes consist of fill in the blanks if you know what the blanks should be, if you don't you're on the wrong path. She's willing to help but if you get behind, it may already be too late
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: This woman does not put in a grade to save her life. It's over halfway through the semester and we have done 3 projects without a single grade for them. Notes are all fill in blank, which I did not like since you had to watch the videos she makes while trying to fill in the blanked out powerpoint pdf. The quizzes and tests arent terrible but meh.

I had her for online this summer, and I found the class to be fairly easy, but then again Ive taken multiple stats classes in high school and college already. Her video lectures cover everything you need to know for the quizzes and exams, so watch those and youll be golden. The HW was time consuming, but not difficult.

Slight warning. Tests are completely different from the homework. You'll spend most of your time trying to decipher what she's asking because she'll just use abbreviations not covered on Aleks. I'm sure she's nice and all, it just seems like she's more interested in making the tests seem more clever than they really are.

She is currently my online professor and she is horrible. She gives minimal help on emails, just says to read the syllabus. She is the WORST online teacher ever. The whole point of online is to be flexible. I am currently very sick and she wouldn't extend a test ONE day. The quizzes are opened and closed over the weekend. HORRIBLE DO NOT TAKE HER.

You'll get a good grade in this class as long as you take notes during lecture and do the homework. She gives lots of examples and is willing to explain concepts in depth with the class. She is a fair professor who wants you to succeed and will challenge you to do your best. There were 4 tests, including the final which is not cumulative.

This class was my main grade booster this semester... Mrs. Parkhurst is an excellent professor. She has moved back projects according to how many people have watched her videos (apparently she can see that). Shes also given surveys to see when we want to have an assessment. She helps her students out the best she can- help yourself out (get an A)

Professor Parkhurst is a great lecturer. I am usually not very good at math, but she helps explain the subject in a very easy way. She also allows us to have one index card as a cheat sheet for every test. Her class is very easy if you show up and pay attention.
Amazing. Very helpful, understanding and taught the material very well.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--Participation matters

comment: Mrs. Parkhurst is one of the most caring and helpful professors. She goes over the material in a simple way so that everyone can understand it. Unlike some professors who favor their easy learners, she takes her time. She made it stress free and gave me hope to get a good grade in the class. I HIGHLY recommend her if you worry about math!

(hybrid) I don't recommend taking her if you like receiving your grades in a timely fashion. She waited till the last day to post her final grade for the class. She didn't calculate my final grade correctly at first. She is not quick to respond to emails. She is always cancelling class. We have had class cancelled more than we actually have met.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Group projects

comment: Great choice for STAT1401. She makes the material easy to understand and gives plenty of extra practice to make sure you know how to do everything. She lets you use a notecard with whatever you want to write on it on all of the tests. Only work outside of class is maybe one online homework assignment per week.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Shes by far is the best professor at Kennesaw State. She loves all of her students and wants them all to succeed . Her class is not easy, but with effort an A or B is very possible.

Best professor Ive had so far. If you suck at math you need her in your life. She breaks it all the way down for you. I recommend printing out the slides before class. Tests were a major part of the grade but she lets you use a notecard. Attendance is not mandatory but if you are bad at math you DO NOT want to miss a class.
I barely showed up to class but the tests were not very difficult. Would recommend going just because of some details she only discusses in class. She is very approachable and easy to get help from.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: If you dont pay attention in this class, you wont get a good grade. Shes not a hard teacher unless you dont try. There is online homework which are super easy and they help you understand the material better if you didnt understand it during class. Do the extra practice she gives because thats basically whats on the test.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Mrs. Parkhurst is super nice and a great professor. Doing the online hw is an easy and helpful grade booster. DO THE EXTRA PRACTICE b/c they are exactly like the tests. Pay attention to how solves problems in class since thats how she wants it done on the test. The quizzes are easy if you paid attention, and the lowest quiz score gets dropped.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Mrs. Parkhurst is a great and an approachable professor. As someone who struggles with stat, she helps simply the toughest subjects. Her class is a bit slow, but attending them are important b/c its the only way to get notes. The tests are fairly simple if you do them the way shown in class. If you need an A, this class is a solid choice.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Parkhurst was an okay teacher. She went slow for people who were not good at math and offered office hours after her night classes for extra help. If you want to pass take very detailed notes and when she says you don't need to write it down(WRITE IT DOWN). The Stat Lab was very helpful and the extra practice looked exactly like the test
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Mrs. Parkhurst really is a gem for people who usually hate math. I hadn't taken a math class in forever, and her teaching style was very forgiving. You need to show up and take good notes on how she wants you to show your work on the quizzes/tests. Go to the Stat Lab for extra help and do the extra practice (they're the blueprint for her tests).
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: If you're good at math, this class will be boring for you. She goes at a slow pace, but it's to help the students that struggle with math. Show up to class because she'll show you how she wants you to show your work and if you don't, that's points off on tests. She does allow notecards on exams. She is nice and wants to help if you need it.

Very nice professor! She moves slow for students who may be struggling and often goes over how to use the calculator. She wants work done exactly how she teaches it. Homework is online and is easy. She gives notecards for the tests. Takes attendance but not for a grade, some pop quizzes. If you skip a lot of class she won't help you.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Mrs. Parkhurst is amazing. She is always willing to stay after class and help you. If you show her that you are trying she will get you through this class.

Online textbook and online homework. She is a generous grader, dropped the 2 lowest quizzes and curved almost every test. Stats itself is difficult, but she makes it easy to understand. Show up to class, do the homework and you should pass the class

I was worried about doing well coming into this class, but Professor Parkhurst made the material very understandable. She is so sweet and lenient. If you go to class, pay attention, and do the HW, you should pass. 7 quizzes and 4 exams (tests- index card). HW @ least once a week, but not too difficult, helps you pass tests. Highly recommend!

Prof. Parkhurst is truly one of the best math professors I've ever had. She is always willing to answer questions, and if you have one, she walks you through the steps. Make sure to check on connect for weekly hw!! (I would have had an A if I checked twice a week).

Professor Parkhurst has been my favorite professor so far at Kennesaw! Super sweet lady who really wants to help her students succeed. She was always easy to talk to and communicate with and willing to help. She did take attendance but not really for a grade, just so she knew who was actually showing up and how their grades reflected that.

I love Mrs. Parkhurst! I honestly hated math before I took this class and I have never been good at it before her. she is a total game changer. She explains everything so well and really takes the time to make sure that you understand before moving onto the next topic. 10/10 would recommend

Mrs. Parkhurst was a great teacher!! She thoroughly explains the material. Exams are straightforward and she gives you opportunities for extra credit. Don't wait until last minute to do homework as it's an easy grade- unlimited attempts. Attendance not mandatory but I highly recommend especially if math is not your strong suit.

I highly recommend taking Professor Parkhurst's class if you get the chance. She is very respectable and is always willing to provide extra help. I also recommend always doing the examples along with her in class! Her tests and quizzes are straightforward and cover the inclass examples and notes!

Mrs. Parkhurst is an extremely caring person. If you don't understand something, she's more than willing to go over it. She allows a 3x5 note card for all tests and a 5x8 note card for the final. I wasn't great at stats, but I made A's on her tests.

Really nice professor. Fair in her grading and she explains everything very well. Do ask questions and she'll explain things differently. Her class is easy as long as you attend, pay attention, and do the online homework. easy.

Professor Parkhurst is a huge asset to KSU.  She is a professor who is passionate about her job and wholeheartedly cares about the success of all her students.  I have not taken a math class in quite sometime, therefore this was a challenge for me.  Her understanding, openness and willingness to help added that extra confidence that I needed.   :-)

Mrs. Parkhurst is a very nice and teaches clearly. She makes understanding STAT very easy and gives you a 3x5 note card to use on the exams. You're going to have to work a lil bit to get an A but an easy class to pass. Take her if you struggle with math because she is very helpful. She does take role as well.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Attendance is not mandatory, but it's in your best interest if you go.

Parkhurst is AMAZING. She makes this class extremely easy and does a great job in introducing new material. She doesn't mind answering questions or going over the material again if need be. I wish all Professors were like her..!! I enjoy going to her class and would sign up for any class she is teaching.

By far the best professor I've had at KSU. Her first words to us were "my goal is to help you beat your fear of statistics," and she ABSOLUTELY did! Her lectures are straightforward and clear. She is extremely helpful and cares about the well being of her students. Do the homework and go to class. Put in the effort and it's an EASY A!

By far the best professor I have taken. She is the kindest woman ever and will do anything to help her students. Tests are easy and you get a note card for all of them. Weekly homework is easy and really helps you prepare for the test.  Class isn't mandatory but if you miss less than three you get two percentage points on final grade. EASY A!

I absolutely loved Professor Parkhurst. She is willing to stop the lecture to help any individual student at any time. She made learning statistics very fun. I was highly impressed with her and her ability to not become frustrated with us. She is available in for all of her office hours and never skips a moment to lend you a helping hand.

Parkhurst is so awesome. I had never taken a stat class before  and I was scared, but she makes it so easy. 4 tests homework online every week. Don't sweat the homework it's so easy. She lets you have a note card for the test I've made A's on every assignment. TAKE HER!!!!!! She's very sweet and understanding, she is more than willing to help!!

She's really easy, but her class is also so boring. The only reason I go to class is to get the extra credit for not missing more than three days. She puts notes online, and you can learn all of it from the homework basically. She is willing to work with you, and help if you put in the effort. Also class is usually let out early.

Thee easiest math teacher I've ever experienced. She worked in corporate for a while so she puts statistics in a real-world set up. She lets you use a flash card on every test and gives you 8 tries on homework. Very flexible w HW.  Gives 2% extra credit for coming to class.I've not broken a sweat in this class and currently have a 98. TAKE HER!!!!

Mrs. Parkhurst was one of the best profs especially math I've had ! She makes sure everyone understands the material before moving ahead and gives ample opportunities to pass. She allows us to use a 5x7 flash card on tests and quizzes are hw assignments in connect math.  Great for people bad at math (like me). Made a B with no stress!
